intro: Myosotis refracta subsp. paucipilosa, commonly known as the slender forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its shorter, more compact inflorescence compared to other forms of Myosotis refracta. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream sides. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom from late winter to early spring.
